comments.text: AzureBackend is not localizable in about:support.
comments.author: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com
comments.creator: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com
comments.raw_text: AzureBackend is not localizable in about:support.

comments.creator: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com
comments.author: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com
comments.text: See bug 707223 comment 3 for the cause.
comments.raw_text: See bug 707223 comment 3 for the cause.
What exactly do you mean?  Now that bug 707223 is fixed, is this fixed too?
comments.author: adw@mozilla.com
comments.text: What exactly do you mean?  Now that bug 707223 is fixed, is this fixed too?
comments.creator: adw@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
It looks like only some of the data in the "graphics" snapshotFormatter is mapped to localized strings, and data.info isn't.

I think that's what this about; things like "GPU Accelerated Windows" are localized, but "AzureContentBackend" isn't. Not sure this is worth fixing, though - it seems to me like having localized row names for about:support has only a minimal benefit, particularly for a setting this obscure.
